subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Higher usage caps than free tier, e.g., up to 80 messages every 3 hours on GPT-4o. Limits are dynamic and subject to change.
5x more usage than the free tier, with higher limits for creating conversations and using features like Projects.
Included in Claude Pro usage cap, offering a very high number of Haiku interactions.
Access to Gemini Advanced (1.5 Pro) within Google products (Gemini, Workspace, etc.), no explicit token limit.
Access via the 'Gemini Advanced' subscription tier.

llama_3_70b_instruct.notes: Open source model. Costs are associated with self-hosting (compute, infrastructure) not token fees. Pricing varies across cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure).

subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Priority access to latest models (like GPT-4 Turbo) during peak times, faster performance, and creation of Copilot GPTs.

pricing_analysis.subscription_adoption_rate: High for consumer use, with the $20/month tier (ChatGPT Plus, Claude Pro, Copilot Pro) becoming the standard for premium access.
pricing_analysis.trend: Aggressive price compression led by Chinese models (DeepSeek, Qwen) and Google's efficiency model (Gemini Flash). Major players are competing by offering cheaper, smaller-speed models alongside flagship ones. The cost of a top-tier model has plummeted, with GPT-4o being significantly cheaper than its predecessor, GPT-4 Turbo. Subscription models are bundling access to these powerful models, abstracting away per-token costs for the average user.
